A **broadsword** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a one-handed [melee](/wiki/Melee "Melee") weapon that is made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron").

For [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai"), the broadsword appears as a **ninja-to**.

## Generation

Ordinary broadswords make up about 0.8% of randomly generated weapons (on the floor, as [death drops](/wiki/Death_drop "Death drop"), or in [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop")).

General [stores](/wiki/Store "Store") and antique weapons outlets can sell broadswords.

[Yendorian Army](/wiki/Yendorian_Army "Yendorian Army") [lieutenants](/wiki/Lieutenant "Lieutenant") have a 1⁄2 chance of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a broadsword.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) [Balrogs](/wiki/Balrog "Balrog") are always generated with broadswords.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Broadsword skill

| Broadsword |                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Max        | [Role](/wiki/Role "Role")                                                                                                                                                            |
| Basic      | - [Tourist](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist")                                                                                                                                                 |
| Skilled    | * [Barbarian](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian"), [Knight](/wiki/Knight "Knight"), [Rogue](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue"), [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai"), [Valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") |

The following weapons use the **broadsword skill**:

- broadsword
- [elven broadsword](/wiki/Elven_broadsword "Elven broadsword")
- [runesword](/wiki/Runesword "Runesword")

Three [artifacts](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") use the broadsword skill:

- [Dragonbane](/wiki/Dragonbane "Dragonbane") (broadsword)
- [Orcrist](/wiki/Orcrist "Orcrist") (elven broadsword)
- [Stormbringer](/wiki/Stormbringer "Stormbringer") (runesword)

## Strategy

Broadswords by themselves are serviceable if unremarkable weapons, but can usually be replaced by a better weapon such as an elven broadsword in short order. The broadsword skill in general is most often relevant for [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic") characters seeking to obtain Stormbringer as early as possible, or else using an elven broadsword as a secondary option for [twoweapon](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon").

## History

The broadsword first appears in [NetHack 1.3d](/wiki/NetHack_1.3d "NetHack 1.3d"), where it is known as a **broad sword**. In [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), the item's name is changed to "broadsword".

From NetHack 3.0.0 to [NetHack 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10"), the base item of Stormbringer is a broadsword.

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Basket-hilted sword](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basket-hilted_sword "wikipedia:Basket-hilted sword")***

"Broadsword" is the modern name for the historical basket-hilted sword, a type of sword generally used for military purposes in the early modern era of the 16th century and seen as late as the early 20th. The eponymous guard for hand protection is developed from the standard "quillon" [crossguard](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crossguard "wikipedia:Crossguard"), and is the result of firearms rendering many forms of armor ineffective - "true" broadswords are double-edged, while those with single-edged blades and thickened backs are generally called "backswords".

The term "broad" contrasts the cutting and thrusting weapon with the [rapier](/wiki/Rapier "Rapier"), which has a more slender blade and is designed primarily for thrusting alone; some rapiers feature a broadsword-like blade paired with typical rapier hilts and sometimes with similar crossguards.T

## Variants

Some variants that incorporate the [Convict](/wiki/Convict "Convict") patch usually include their designated first [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift"): [Luck Blade](/wiki/Luck_Blade "Luck Blade"), a chaotic artifact broadsword that acts as a [luck item](/wiki/Luck_item "Luck item") while carried.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), a broadsword is always generated next to the left sink on the goal level of the [Yeoman quest](/wiki/Yeoman_quest "Yeoman quest").

[Upgrading](/wiki/Upgrading "Upgrading") a broadsword will produce an elven broadsword, and vice versa.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), [Luck Blade](/wiki/Luck_Blade_\(UnNetHack\) "Luck Blade (UnNetHack)") is a chaotic artifact broadsword that acts as the first sacrifice gift for Convicts.

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") add the [isamusei](/index.php?title=Isamusei\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Isamusei (page does not exist)"), [beamsword](/index.php?title=Beamsword\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Beamsword (page does not exist)") and [force sword](/index.php?title=Force_sword\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Force sword (page does not exist)") as weapons that use the broadsword skill.

[The Water Crystal](/wiki/The_Water_Crystal "The Water Crystal") increases a character's skill cap for broadswords by 1 while carried.

Several artifacts in dNetHack use the broadsword skill:

- [Fire Brand](/wiki/Fire_Brand "Fire Brand") and [Frost Brand](/wiki/Frost_Brand "Frost Brand") can generate in broadsword form.

- The [Fuma-itto no Ken](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Fuma-itto_no_Ken "DNetHack artifacts") is a chaotic broadsword that is permanently [poisoned](/wiki/Poison "Poison"), grants +1 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") and +1d8 damage bonuses versus cross-aligned targets, and can be [invoked](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke") to [create a stack of](/wiki/Create_ammo "Create ammo") [shuriken](/wiki/Shuriken "Shuriken").

- The [Atma Weapon](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Atma_Weapon "DNetHack artifacts") is an unaligned beamsword that can be [applied](/wiki/Applied "Applied") to turn it on and off, and follows [lightsaber](/wiki/Lightsaber "Lightsaber") rules with the following exceptions:

  - While on, it deals 3d10+(3x enchantment) to both large and small monsters, with bonuses of +1d6 to-hit and +3d6 damage against [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY") monsters.
  - If wielded without [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance"), Atma Weapon adds +1dx damage (where *x* is the wielder's current experience level) while severely reducing the wielder's natural healing rate, and scales its damage with their current HP percentage. Additionally, if Atma Weapon wielded while cursed and activated, or else it is activated while cursed or uncharged, it will drain an experience level and uncurse and/or charge itself.
  - If wielded with drain resistance, its base damage is decreased to 2d10+(2x enchantment) against all monsters.

- [Glamdring](/wiki/Glamdring_\(dNetHack\) "Glamdring (dNetHack)") is a lawful elven broadsword that favors [Nobles](/wiki/Noble "Noble") and is the first sacrifice gift for [dwarven](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)") [Knights](/wiki/Knight "Knight"). It has +1d5 to-hit and deals +1d10 damage versus all monsters, along with dealing an additional +1d20 to [orcs](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_attribute\) "Orc (monster attribute)") and [demons](/wiki/MA_DEMON "MA DEMON") and [warning of both monster types](/wiki/Warned_of_monster_type "Warned of monster type") while wielded. Glamdring cannot be knocked out of the player character's hands while wielded.

- [The Rod of the Elvish Lords](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#The_Rod_of_the_Elvish_Lords "DNetHack artifacts") is a lawful [elven](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)") Noble-favoring artifact that can take the form of an elven broadsword, and engraves at the same quality as an [athame](/wiki/Athame "Athame") in this form.

### DynaHack

In [DynaHack](/wiki/DynaHack "DynaHack"), [Luck Blade](/wiki/Luck_Blade_\(DynaHack\) "Luck Blade (DynaHack)") is an [intelligent artifact](/wiki/Intelligent_artifact "Intelligent artifact") and is otherwise the same as in UnNetHack.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), [Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk") and [Rangers](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger") can now train the broadsword skill - Monks can reach Basic, Rangers can reach Skilled, and Knights can reach Expert.

Luck Blade has the same traits as in UnNetHack, but is made of [steel](/wiki/Steel "Steel") rather than iron.

A broadsword can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining a [scimitar](/wiki/Scimitar "Scimitar") and a [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword"). Broadswords can be used to create a few items:

- A broadsword can be combined with an [axe](/wiki/Axe "Axe") to create a [battle-axe](/wiki/Battle-axe "Battle-axe").
- A broadsword can be combined with a [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword") to create a [two-handed sword](/wiki/Two-handed_sword "Two-handed sword")
- A broadsword can be combined with a [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger") to create a [runesword](/wiki/Runesword "Runesword").
- A broadsword can be combined with a [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear") to create a [partisan](/wiki/Partisan "Partisan").

## Encyclopaedia entry

Bring me my broadsword  
And clear understanding.  
Bring me my cross of gold,  
As a talisman.  
\[ "Broadsword" (refrain) by Ian Anderson ]
